So the phone has some buttons, you can scroll, you can touch things.

To us as the user, all we really care about is the interface between us and what task we

And so that's the idea of abstraction, right?
The phone is basically abstracted away all of those hardware details, all of those implementations

So the user doesn't need to know how it works in order to use it.
Now abstraction actually enables decomposition, what does that mean?
Well, once we abstract away details, we can have different manufacturers working on different
